trans-unit.source: Provides a single static <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter.Save*"></xref> method (multiple overloads) that can be used for limited XAML serialization of provided run-time objects into XAML markup.
The serialization enabled by this method has a series of limitations.
This is because the serialization enabled is explicitly run-time, and does not have access to possible design-time information in the original XAML (if any).
For details, see [Serialization Limitations of XamlWriter.Save](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/serialization-limitations-of-xamlwriter-save.md).
Calling <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter.Save%2A> is not permitted when running in partial trust.
This includes from XBAPs.
Returns a XAML string that serializes the specified object and its properties.
The serialization enabled by this method has a series of limitations.
This is because the serialization enabled is explicitly run-time, and does not have access to possible design-time information in the original XAML (if any).
For details, see [Serialization Limitations of XamlWriter.Save](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/serialization-limitations-of-xamlwriter-save.md).
Calling <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter.Save%2A> is not permitted when running in partial trust.
The element to be serialized.
Typically, this is the root element of a page or application.
A XAML string that can be written to a stream or file.
The logical tree of all elements that fall under the provided obj element will be serialized.
obj is `null`.
The application is not running in full trust.
Saves XAML information into a specified stream to serialize the specified object and its properties.
The serialization enabled by this method has a series of limitations.
This is because the serialization enabled is explicitly run-time, and does not have access to possible design-time information in the original XAML (if any).
For details, see [Serialization Limitations of XamlWriter.Save](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/serialization-limitations-of-xamlwriter-save.md).
Calling <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter.Save%2A> is not permitted when running in partial trust.
The element to be serialized.
Typically, this is the root element of a page or application.
Destination stream for the serialized XAML information.
obj or stream is `null`.
The application is not running in full trust.
Saves XAML information as the source for a provided <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> object.
The output of the <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> can then be used to serialize the provided object and its properties.
The serialization enabled by this method has a series of limitations.
This is because the serialization enabled is explicitly run-time, and does not have access to possible design-time information in the original XAML (if any).
For details, see [Serialization Limitations of XamlWriter.Save](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/serialization-limitations-of-xamlwriter-save.md).
Calling <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter.Save%2A> is not permitted when running in partial trust.
The element to be serialized.
Typically, this is the root element of a page or application.
A <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> instance as the destination where the serialized XAML information is written.
obj or writer is `null`.
The application is not running in full trust.
Saves XAML information into a custom serializer.
The output of the serializer can then be used to serialize the provided object and its properties.
The serialization enabled by this method has a series of limitations.
This is because the serialization enabled is explicitly run-time, and does not have access to possible design-time information in the original XAML (if any).
For details, see [Serialization Limitations of XamlWriter.Save](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/serialization-limitations-of-xamlwriter-save.md).
Calling <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter.Save%2A> is not permitted when running in partial trust.
The element to be serialized.
Typically, this is the root element of a page or application.
A custom serialization implementation.
obj or manager is `null`.
The application is not running in full trust.
Saves XAML information as the source for a provided <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> object.
The output of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> can then be used to serialize the provided object and its properties.
The serialization enabled by this method has a series of limitations.
This is because the serialization enabled is explicitly run-time, and does not have access to possible design-time information in the original XAML (if any).
For details, see [Serialization Limitations of XamlWriter.Save](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/serialization-limitations-of-xamlwriter-save.md).
Calling <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter.Save%2A> is not permitted when running in partial trust.
The element to be serialized.
Typically, this is the root element of a page or application.
Writer to use to write the serialized XAML information.
obj or xmlWriter is `null`.
The application is not running in full trust.
